page.title: 02CHURCHES IN HOLT (PART ONE)
page.content: There has been some kind of church in Holt since the 14th Century, but St. Katharine's Church dates back to the 19th Century. St. Katharine's is a Church of England Church. There are three buildings in Holt which have been vicarages; this is the reason why. The first vicarage was on The Green and it was occupied by a bachelor vicar. He got engaged to a girl whose family owned Harvey's Bristol Cream (a sherry company). Her parents thought that the vicarage was too small, so St. Katharine's House was built. Later, the church commisioners decided that many vicarages were too big to keep, so they built another, smaller one, in the grounds of St. Katharine's House. There are two churches in Holt because there were Christians who didn't wish to belong to the official Church.
